trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the call is to an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject"></xref> object that has aborted.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException> is a derived class of <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException?displayProperty=fullName> and can occur in correct applications.

Because typically the code that calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Abort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method reports the error condition that caused the call to <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Abort%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this exception indicates that the call failed but the most useful error information is elsewhere.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException"></xref> class with the specified message.
Creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException> using the specified `message`.
The message carried in the exception.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException"></xref> class used to deserialize data into a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException"></xref> object.
This constructor is called during deserialization to restore the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
Creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException> using the specified `message` and `innerException`.
